subject: Productivity
title: Drucker and the Knowledge Worker
description: A 60-second lesson on Drucker and the Knowledge Worker.

hook.text: Peter Drucker saw something in 1959 that most missed: the future economy would run on brains, not hands.

buildup.text: He coined the term knowledge worker for people whose main tool is their mind, not their body.

discovery.text: Knowledge workers can't be managed like factory workers. You can't time a thought with a stopwatch.

twist.text: Drucker warned that managing knowledge work was the biggest unsolved challenge of the 21st century.

climax.text: That challenge remains. Most offices still use industrial-era management for brain-based work.

punchline.text: We manage thoughts with factory tools. It doesn't work.

quiz.question: What did Peter Drucker predict about the future economy?
options: It would run on knowledge work, not manual labor
